content.description: Sit start on the arete on the left side of the Upset boulder and traverse right into the Melancholy Mantle.
content.location: The arete of the Upset Boulder

content.description: Start standing on the small block that is jammed under the Wave boulder with both hands underclinging the Wave face. Make some unique moves through the slopey undercling holds and top out straight above using the large sidepull rail.
Start low on the backwall in the center of the roof and climb the line of juggy holds out to the crack on the face, using it to top out.Tape gloves and a knee pad are helpful on this line.
content.location: On the left side of the Mega Roof Boulder.Â

content.description: Sit start on the jug at the base of the small cave. Starts about 3 feet to the right of the Heelium crack. Climb straight up through a cool sloper and pocket to a long move to the juggy top.
content.location: On the right side of the Mega Roof Boulder

content.description: Start with the only good looking foot at the bottom of the slab and your choice of "hands." Climb straight up.This line does NOT live up to the name of the boulder it's on and is basically the exact opposite of a Mega Roof, but is it still worth climbing? Sure, why not?
content.location: The farthest right line on the Mega Roof Boulder

content.description: Start on the farthest right side of the boulder on the sloper rail. Traverse the whole boulder all the way to the end before topping out.The backwall of choss is off.

Sit start on your choice of juggy holds under the mini roof, just right of the Mustang topout (look for the saddlehorn hold) and traverse the whole boulder all the way to the left, topping out once you reach the end.The backwall of choss is off.
Sit start on jugs at the back of the small cave. Climb out using the good crimp rail and make a big slap for the slopey arete. Move left to the flat juggy topout
content.location: On the left side of the Bat Cave Boulder

content.description: Sit start under the small roof on your choice of chalked up jugs. Climb out through mega jugs and slightly left to a couple large undercling pockets and use them to make a long reach to the nearest hold. Top out to the left on the clean section.
Start under the small roof on the far left side of the boulder on your choice of jugs and traverse right until you can topout. Named after the cool QP shaped flake near the topout of the boulder.
content.protection: A pad, or not. It's only 6 or 7 feet tall.
content.location: On the Quarterpipe boulder. This is the first boulder in the main area.Exact location: 39.876716, -81.036095

content.description: Jump up to a left hand sloper and right hand to the lowest section of the rail and climb up the rail to top out.
Stand start on a 2 finger pocket and 2 finger edge on the left side of the boulder and traverse right to the juggy rail before topping out.

Start on the juggy pocket and anything else you want to use in the head height hueco and make a long move up and right to the juggy lip, finishing off with a slopey mantle.Grade is a total guess on this. I have not tried this one yet but it's clean and ready for action!
content.location: In the center of the Mega Roof Boulder. Step up on the large boulder sticking out of the ground to reach the start holds.

content.description: Start at the base of the roof under the arete. Climb straight out the roof using the obvious line of really interesting holds under the arete to a harrowing topout.Must be equal parts strong and bold to tick this one off! The grade is a guess and could go a few grades in either direction, although I doubt it's easier than V10.
content.protection: All the pads and a good spotter.
content.location: On the far left side just under the arete of the Mega Roof Boulder.

content.description: This is the direct for Night Moves.Stand start matched on the right facing sidepull flake just beneath the topout for Night Moves. Get established and climb straight up.Exceptional movement on this one!
Stand start on good slopers and climb up the arete. Everything left of the crack on "Cam A Lot" is off.
Sit start under the roof on the lowest large jug. Climb out and up the arete, avoiding using everything left of the crack on the "Cam A Lot" arete.

Mega Classic!Sit start on a sharp jug under the small roof on the left side of the night moves boulder. Climb out the roof to the long seam and traverse right through jugs, pockets, and crimps for about 30 moves until the seam ends and topout on obvious line of holds. Once you get through the initial jug haul, it builds in intensity with every move until you finally reach the heady, committing topout.
Start on the far right side of the boulder on the sloper rail and traverse it left. Top out on Mustang.The backwall of choss is off.
Start on your choice of jugs (same as Stiletto) under the mini roof just to the right of the saddle horn hold. Use the crack and the saddle horn to top out.The backwall of choss is off.
Sit Start on any jugs under the right side of the roof. Climb out the roof and up through a really awesome hand jam move to the top.
content.location: On the right side of the Bat Cave Boulder

content.description: Sit start with both hands on the lips of the sad face and climb straight up.This is a classic mantle problem!

Same finish as lumberjack instead of using the jugs out left you climb beneath the roof of lumberjack making some big moves. Holding the foot cut is hard and the big move up to the crimp rail is harder without the good heel hooks out left.Â
content.location: Same finish as lumberjack, start beneath the roof not using the jugs out left.Â

content.description: Best line on this boulder. Sit start under the mini roof on your choice of jugs. Climb out to the mega jugs and move right (just past the tree) through a couple crimp rails which will take you to the top.

This is an extension of Heelium where you trade a harder start for an easier finish.Start matched on the jugs at the base of the small roof about 3 feet right of the crack. Move left to the "Heelium" crack and continue up to the sloper rail. Once you hit the sloper rail, traverse left all the way until it gets juggy and mantle up to top out. This has some incredible movement!
content.location: On the right side of the Mega Roof Boulder

content.description: Sit start in the large jug pocket in the middle of the boulder and climb up through the 3 small crimps on the face.A bit contrived since you could just do the Raven move off the underclings, but this is a really fun version and using the crimps actually feels more natural than the undercling reach.

Stand start matched on 2 pointy holds in the hueco and climb left to the flake with the pockets in it. Get both hands out to the holds in the flake and power up to the slopey lip from there, finishing with a mantle.
content.location: In the center of the Mega Roof Boulder. Step up on the large boulder sticking out of the ground to reach the start holds.

content.description: Stand start matched on 2 obvious holds inside the Hueco and climb up and slightly left through the path of least resistance to a tall slopey mantle.
content.location: In the center of the Mega Roof Boulder. Step up on the large boulder sticking out of the ground to reach the start holds.

content.description: One of the best climbs at the main area!Sit start at the base of the obvious crack on the right side of the Mega Roof boulder. Climb the crack up and go left when you get to the tree. Topout using the first set of sloper rails you reach. The topout is pretty committing, but that heel will float you right up to the top.
content.location: On the right side of the Mega Roof Boulder

content.description: Sit start matched in the hueco just to the right of the "Bone Collector" start hold and climb up and then left. They top out the same.

Start on good holds under the roof. Traverse left past "The Raven" through jugs, good crimps, and a small blank section (the crux) to topout at the same spot as "The Raven" between the 2 trees.The first boulder problem ever to be cleaned and climbed at Raven Rocks! Michael Brown cleaned and did the FA on this line, Ray Weber added a slightly lower start coming out of "The Tomb" (the small cave) which adds a few nice moves!
Sit start on the far left side of the triangular sloper rail on the Night Moves boulder and traverse right until you reach the end of the rail. Climb up the dihedral through easy jugs to top out
Sit start matched in the large hueco on the far left side of The Raven boulder and climb straight up.

Start with right hand on a good sidepull and left on a bad sidepull. Pull hard on the good sidepull to get up to the crimps directly above and move slightly right through jugs to topout at the first spot with a clean topout.This is one of the better lines on this little boulder!
3 fun direct V3's on this boulder. All 3 with low sit starts. See picture for start hold beta for all 3 lines.1. Climb the left side2. Climb the middleÂ 3. Climb the right side
This is the first area you reach from the parking lot and has a very short and easy approach.
